alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 8:10AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A BAND OF VERY HEAVY SNOW LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CENTRAL ST. LAWRENCE COUNTY THROUGH 1000 AM EST... At 807 AM EST, heavy snow was reported over Fowler, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...A band of very heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH is creating frequent visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and will blow around unsecured objects. Very low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Gouverneur, Canton, De Kalb, Fowler, Colton, Rensselaer Falls, Morley, Degrasse, Hermon, Carry Falls Reservoir, Richville, Norwood, Pierrepont, Russell, Fine, Rossie, Pitcairn, Stark and Edwards. This includes Route 11 between Antwerp and Potsdam. Travel may be nearly impossible in this area with blizzard conditions.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
